4.  [### 16:24Man Utd 'far from perfect' in win over Everton - Amorim. Video, 00:03:23, published at 16:24Man Utd 'far from perfect' in win over Everton - Amorim](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/videos/c5y311xzvxko)
    
    *   Attribution

    3:23
    
    ![Image 24: Ruben Amorim](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/480/cpsprodpb/1841/live/6e619e60-affe-11ef-bdf5-b7cb2fa86e10.jpg)
    
5.  ![Image 25: Marcus Rashford and Andre Onana of Manchester United react after the team's victory in the Premier League match between Manchester United FC and Everton FC](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/7d3d/live/a40cc8f0-affe-11ef-a88f-9db5c484bac5.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Manchester United's win over Everton at Old Trafford under Ruben Amorim is the biggest margin of victory for a permanent manager in their first home match in the competition for the club.
    
    Marcus Rashford has now scored in back-to-back Premier League matches under Ruben Amorim (three goals), as many goals as he managed in his previous 23 matches under both Ruud van Nistelrooy and Erik ten Hag.
    
6.  ![Image 26: Manchester United's Portuguese head coach Ruben Amorim gestures on the touchline during the English Premier League football match between Manchester United and Everton at Old Trafford ](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/1e19/live/ad56b3c0-affa-11ef-a58d-210a453eafad.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    **Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim has been talking to BBC Match of the Day after the win:** "It was far from a perfect performance. We have to improve, you can feel that in the game. After 15 minutes, Everton controlled the game and it was difficult for us and we were losing the second balls.
    
    "I felt that the players could solve some problems that we had as a team because of the quality that they have, but it was far from a perfect performance. But it was a really good result and a tough match."
    
    **On their opening goal:** "You have to congratulate the players and the rest of the staff. The most important thing on set-pieces is the staff, so great job.
    
    "You can see how tall they are and how small we are as a team, so we tried to see where we would have space to create danger."
    
    **On Amad Diallo:** "He is really big in talent, but small in size. He did a great job but he also has to improve. He is in a great moment. Ruud van Nistelrooy helped him a lot in his games in charge and now he is helping me."
    
    **On the mood becoming more buoyant and optimistic:** "It helps to have a new face, it always helps. We have to be very clear to our fans and this will always help.
    
    "Rather than trying to convince the fans about this performance, \[it is better to say\] we have a lot to do, it will take time. Sometimes we are not playing well but everyone defended together.
    
    "Our fans just ask for hard work and then, in time, they will ask for better football."
    
7.  ![Image 27: Marcus Rashford of Manchester United celebrates Jarrad Branthwaite of Everton scoring an own goal during the Premier League match between Manchester United FC and Everton FC at Old Trafford on December 01, 2024](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/3351/live/3e436130-affb-11ef-a58d-210a453eafad.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    **Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford has been talking to Sky Sports following the victory:** "It is a nice result. It is important with a new coach and a new way of playing, when we are still learning. We have to back up this performance and win midweek.
    
    "We all, as individuals, want to get back to our best and then push to improve so, even in the bad moments, you are doing the right thing.
    
    "The connection is going to build and grow the more we get used to him. He has \[Ruben Amorim\] come in a busy period and hopefully the connection keeps building and growing. He has come in with a great attitude and it has passed onto the players.
    
    "The atmosphere is one of the most special things about his club, and playing at this great stadium is always a great feeling.
    
    "It is early on but I feel energised and ready for the next game. This game has only just finished, but the next one is always the focus for the players."

12.  ![Image 35: Chris Sutton's predictions v boxer Sunny Edwards](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/7ed7/live/fc95ce60-ae44-11ef-bdf5-b7cb2fa86e10.png.webp)
    
    Chris Sutton is making predictions for all 380 Premier League games this season, against a variety of guests.
    
    For week 13, he takes on boxer Sunny Edwards who is a Chelsea fan.
    
    **Sutton's prediction: 1-1**
    
    There has been so much hype, or even over-hype, about Manchester United. I feel a bit sorry for their new manager Ruben Amorim because he needs time, and two or three transfer windows, to put things right.
    
    There was a lot of excitement over the way they started his first game in charge, against [Ipswich](http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town), but blimey you have got a problem if the Tractor Boys are out-playing you, which is what happened in the end.
    
    Things got worse for Amorim when Ed Sheeran interrupted his interview on Sky afterwards. I have to give credit to commentator Conor McNamara here, but maybe it is time for Amorim to listen to one of Sheeran's biggest hits and think about 'the shape of Man U'.
    
    I think the reality is hitting home about Amorim using his favoured 3-4-3 formation with their current squad - especially with Christian Eriksen and Casemiro in midfield.
    
    As for Everton, well a fair few of their fans still seem to be on Sean Dyche's back, and they couldn't find a way past 10-man [Brentford](http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/brentford) last week.
    
    This time, they will be the team looking to hold out and I believe they can do it because this Manchester United team is going to take a while to click.
    
    Once the initial buzz of Amorim's first home game dies down, things could go flat at Old Trafford - the way it has done quite a lot recently.
    
    I hope it happens for them under Amorim because he seems like a decent guy, but he's in the Manchester United madhouse now and he's about to find out what it's like to be under the microscope every single week.
    
    **Sunny's prediction: 3-0**
    
    Manchester United haven't been great, but I think they are going to play well in this one.
    
    [Read the full predictions and have your say here](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/articles/ce89x1d34zko)
    
13.  [### 08:18The big Premier League Advent calendar quiz, published at 08:18The big Premier League Advent calendar quiz](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/articles/cm24q590mnjo)

    ![Image 36: BBC Sport day one](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/480/cpsprodpb/09d6/live/a0d94c50-ae8a-11ef-8ab9-9192db313061.jpg)
    
14.  ![Image 38: Ruben Amorim Manager of Manchester United during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD5 training and press conference at Carrington Training Ground on November 27, 2024](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/abf0/live/64ff98c0-af33-11ef-bf13-0d5fafac0b95.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    BBC Sport presenter Mark Chapman has been getting to know Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim in an exclusive Football Focus interview, with the Portuguese manager explaining why he appears to be "very relaxed" in his new job.
    
    "I will be OK - no matter what," Amorim said. "In this stage of my life, I will be OK so that's why I am relaxed.
    
    "Everybody says to me: 'This will change me'. This will not change me.
    
    "If something happens, I will be frustrated for a while but I know I will recover. But I believe that we are going to succeed.
    
    "I'm ready. When I had this invitation, I felt that it was really hard to leave my players at Sporting. But, when I had this opportunity, I felt I had to do this \[and make the move\].
    
    "Maybe it is destiny and I will be a little bit lucky in the beginning and then everything is going to be fine."
    
    Watch the full interview with Ruben Amorim on [Football Focus on iPlayer](https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episodes/b006m8tc/football-focus) or listen to the special [Football Daily podcast on BBC Sounds](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k7y4sr)
    
    ![Image 39: Watch on BBC iPlayer banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/bee0/live/08dcdea0-af28-11ef-8ab9-9192db313061.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 40: BBC Sounds banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/974d/live/fe40f530-af27-11ef-bdf5-b7cb2fa86e10.jpg.webp)
    
15.  ![Image 41: Ruben Amorim, head coach of Manchester United, during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD5 match between Manchester United and FK Bodo/Glimt at Old Trafford](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/1a87/live/b06baf40-af26-11ef-907d-d11d58b97d6a.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Ruben Amorim has become the latest manager to be tasked with restoring Manchester United's on-pitch fortunes.
    
    The club paid £11m to Portuguese club Sporting to recruit the 39-year-old and his staff, making him the sixth permanent manager since Sir Alex Ferguson's illustrious 26-year reign ended with his retirement in 2013.
    
    After a draw at Ipswich and a win against Bodo/Glimt in his first two games, his side host Everton on Sunday (13:30 GMT).
    
    BBC Sport presenter Mark Chapman caught up with the Portuguese manager on Football Focus, firstly asking him if he is already feeling a connection with the Manchester United fans.
    
    "Yes for sure, I feel that" Amorim revealed. "Maybe because I'm a little bit of an emotional person. I can transmit that, even in interviews, I think.
    
    "Maybe because I am different from the last coach and this can bring a different connection with the next guy.
    
    "I believe that I am the right guy. People always believe the next guy is the right guy. We always have this feeling.
    
    "To maintain this feeling, we have to play better and win games and be really honest with the supporters.
    
    "If you are honest and direct with the supporters - maybe you don't always say the popular thing - you can create a better connection."
    
    Watch the full interview with Ruben Amorim on [Football Focus on iPlayer](https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episodes/b006m8tc/football-focus) or listen to the special [Football Daily podcast on BBC Sounds](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k7y4sr)

    ![Image 44: Ruben Amorim](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/480/cpsprodpb/a5a6/live/468b4f00-ae7b-11ef-93a6-9fd2d3586a96.jpg)
    
18.  ![Image 46: Mason Mount warms up before a Manchester United match](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/eca4/live/2bd50e50-ae29-11ef-be95-a1f725d18284.jpg.webp)Image source, PA Media
    
    Mason Mount is a "proper footballer" who wants to succeed at Manchester United, says head coach Ruben Amorim.
    
    Mount, 25, joined from [Chelsea](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea) in the summer of 2023 but his time at Old Trafford so far has been hampered by injury issues.
    
    He started against Bodo/Glimt and played for an hour of Thursday's Europa League victory.
    
    Amorim talked about his "belief" in Mount and said of the England midfielder: "The first thing is he's working really hard. Then you have to understand the human also - he wants this really badly, and that is the most important thing.
    
    "He has proved he is a really talented player. He was a European champion, so we believe in him a lot.
    
    "He has to stay fit and, like all the guys in the team, they are quality players, they have to improve and believe in themselves.
    
    "On Thursday he did a great job. You see some moments and details where you can see that Mason is a proper footballer. We believe in him a lot and I especially believe a lot in Mason."
    
    After a draw at [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) in his first game in charge, Amorim is hopeful of a first Premier League win as United boss against [Everton](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/everton) on Sunday (13:30 GMT).
    
    "It's going to be a different match with a lot of fighting for long balls and second balls," he added.
    
    "They have a quality coach who understands the league and understands the moment of the opponent. We need to have the ball because we have a short time to recover.
    
    "I hope for a win and I hope to see different things in my team improve, like we did from Ipswich to now, against Everton, without training. I expect to see different things and better things."

    We asked for your thoughts after Thursday's Europa League game between Manchester United and Bodo/Glimt.
    
    Here are some of your comments:
    
    **Mike:** It's still early days and improvements are needed, but we are seeing fluid and attacking football return. Garnacho can't cross or shoot. Bodo/Glimt should wrap up their second successive domestic title at the weekend - they would have destroyed an Erik ten Hag team, so they are no walkover! Great possession in positions where it mattered and 20 shots! Hojlund was great.
    
    **Adam:** Taking the lead so early and then throwing it away to go 2-1 down so soon after just shows the frailty of the new system. We were exposed too often but, thankfully, they weren't the strongest of teams so we got off lightly. The major positive of the night has to be Hojlund. He is showing that if you feed him properly, he will do the rest!
    
    **Amogh:** Ruben Amorim showed he is decisive with substitutions and tactically flexible. My worry is that he doesn't have the players to play the system that he wants to play, and that means people playing out of position and not to their strengths. You can get away with that against a mid-table team, but not against a top eight team in the Premier League.
    
    **Brendan:** Ugarte is the glue that keeps this team together. He is a similar player to Roy Keane - impressive. Malacia had so much ball but he was not able to cope with or penetrate the defence. Shaw was dependable as usual. Rashford, regretfully, is a total lost cause and he needs to move on.
    
    **Alex:** Positive signs, definitely, but we have to make sure we don't get too excited. The great thing is that we are starting to see an identity within this team, which we haven't seen in a very long time. I'm very interested to see where we go from here and what our optimal line-up will be.

Amad responds perfectly to Ruben Amorim's touchline reactions in Manchester United win
======================================================================================

Man United secured a first four-goal victory in the Premier League in Ruben Amorim's first league match in charge at Old Trafford.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![Image 1: Samuel Luckhurst](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article22855086.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_WhatsApp-Image-2022-01-24-at-140305.jpg)

By

[Samuel Luckhurst](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/samuel-luckhurst/)Chief Manchester United writer

*   15:33, 1 DEC 2024
*   Updated15:37, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Amad was brilliant against Everton](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491894.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187701412.jpg)

Amad was brilliant against Everton

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Jarrad Branthwaite did not get his move to Manchester United in the summer yet he stepped up as their 12th man against Everton.

A deflection and a dozy pass from the centre back gifted United both of their first-half goals to turn the game on its head. Branthwaite skulked off at half-time with his head bowed, tugging his shirt in the hope it would be big enough to conceal his embarrassed expression. There was a half left to play yet Everton were done.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were otherwise unconvincing in a first half so troubling that Ruben Amorim was plotting a double substitution at half-time. Branthwaite's collapse caused his teammates to also fold. United ran away with it without running much.

After two 3-0 reverses at Old Trafford, the thrashings are being meted out by the home side. There was a hearty and celebratory rendition of "Amorim's Red and White Army" from the Stretford End before the hour, with victory already assured. This was United's first four-goal victory in the Premier League since the opening day of the 2021-22 season.

**READ MORE: [Player ratings vs Everton as Amad brilliant](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30490967)**

**READ MORE: [United vs Everton reaction](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-vs-everton-live-30489781)**

United are literally on the up. The three points have elevated them to the heady heights of ninth in the table, the first time they have been in the top half since October. Their goal difference is finally a positive figure.

The only anger vented by the matchgoers was over the callous ticket price hike by the Ineos cabal. Sir Jim Ratcliffe's Manchester roots have not spared him from the vitriol after spinning supporters a hollow working-class hero yarn.

On the pitch, Amorim had the luxury of introducing the returning Harry Maguire and Luke Shaw before the hour to grant Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui a breather. The festive season commenced with a cheery rendition of "Five Cantonas". In a week the other Manchester side squandered a hefty advantage with a quarter of an hour to play, there was no chance of Everton emulating Feyenoord.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee got two goals apiece but the game belonged to Amad. He made three of the four possible and is the perfect profile of player for Amorim.

It was only nine months ago that Omari Forson (remember him?) started ahead of Amad. Amad's intensity and selflessness have enabled him to swiftly adapt to Amorim's demands. Forson has played three times for Monza.

Rashford's penchant for performing under a new manager (or head coach) has continued with the latest incumbent. His charge and spontaneous strike for United's third goal was reminiscent of his 2022-23 zenith. Rashford is one shy of matching his meagre eight-goal haul of last term.

Everton ordered United to attack the Stretford End in the first half, as they had on their last two visits. Those fixtures ended 2-0. This time it was double that. United fans were "Olé"ing as early as the 75th minute.

Amorim was more animated and impatient at 0-0 than on his previous appearances in the United technical area. He had to clap his hands to alert Casemiro to receive the ball, lamented a risk-aversive pass from De Ligt and in the 19th minute instructed Diogo Dalot to come yet he opted to go.

Before he scored, Zirkzee was berated for being out of position to press. It happened a second time moments later and Amorim reactively turned to the dugout and told Mason Mount and Alejandro Garnacho to warm up. That was in the 24th minute. They were not required at the interval after all.

Zirkzee was the third striker to start in Amorim's third match and all three have scored. Zirkzee favours a deeper role and initially had some joy avoiding duels with Branthwaite but once Everton seized the initiative his positioning began to irk Amorim. Zirkzee and Rasmus Hojlund, whose intense pressing resulted in a goal after 48 seconds against Bodo/Glimt, are polar opposites.

Still, Zirkzee rallied to score his first United goal in 18 games for his second in 19. James Tarkowski's dithering defending charitably made another possible and Zirkzee's body language altered markedly.

His teammates were pleased as punch and he celebrated by pretending to fire a machine gun. He has some way to go to be considered a sharp shooter, though Zirkzee's deeper presence accelerated the attack for Rashford's clinical second goal.

Amorim's wing-back strategy is starting to bear fruit. Amad forced the error from Branthwaite to make it 2-0 through an intense press and his recall effectively cements his status as a first-teamer again.

Amad had earlier irked Amorim by scooping the ball wide from Zirkzee's pass yet he has demonstrated over his four years at United he is not lacking in resilience. He has three assists in two starts under Amorim.

It is a misconception Amad is one of Ten Hag's legacies when his first start under him came in May. There were only ten more and he has slotted in admirably into Amorim's challenging 3-4-3 formation.

Branthwaite had crucially cut out a couple of early crosses before making more decisive contact with Rashford's half-volley to give United a fortuitous lead on 34 minutes. Branthwaite's intervention sent the ball in the opposite direction to the prone Jordan Pickford.

Everton's followers were bullish for half an hour yet when the fourth goal went in, thousands trudged down the gangways to the nearest exit and boos soundtracked Sean Dyche's first round of substitutions. Former United captain Ashley Young departed to a standing ovation yet many in the Everton end did not applaud him.

They had scored fewer goals than United at kick-off and the inclusion of the ungainly Beto did not increase their prospects. At 0-0, he rolled the ball the wrong side of the net with their one sighter.

Branthwaite put it into his own net.

Amad celebrates with Fernandes and Zirkzee

Manchester United thumped Everton 4-0 in Ruben Amorim’s first home Premier League game in charge.

Marcus Rashford gave [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) the lead as his half-volley found the back of the net after a deflection off Jarrad Branthwaite. Joshua Zirkzee struck before half time to put United 2-0 up.

Rashford grabbed his second to end the game as a contest shortly after the break and Zirkzee then joined him on two goals for the afternoon to make it 4-0.

Here are how the players rated at Old Trafford:

**READ MORE: [United vs Everton reaction](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-vs-everton-live-30489781)**

**READ MORE: [United meet Jorge Mendes over possible Geovany Quenda transfer](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-meet-geovany-quendas-30482307)**

**Andre Onana**

Didn't do anything wrong during a difficult first half for United and had a much quieter second 45 minutes as he kept a clean sheet. Saved late on from Dominic Calvert-Lewin. 7

**Noussair Mazraoui**

Had a more testing time against Iliman Ndiaye but came through it to help keep United's sheet clean before he was rested. 6

**Matthijs de Ligt**

Outpaced by Beto for Everton's best chance with the game goalless as he failed to dominate another defender-striker duel. Came off before the hour. 5

**Lisandro Martinez**

Gave Everton an early sighter with a sloppy pass that came to nought. Played Dalot in for a good opening but booked for a cynical foul. 6

**Amad**

Scooped a good chance well wide but forced Jarrad Branthwaite into the mistake that led to the second goal and brilliantly played in Marcus Rashford for the third. 8

**Casemiro**

His tendency to slide in desperately was evident again but Everton never took advantage of Casemiro's clumsiness. 5

**Kobbie Mainoo**

Began brightly on his first start in eight weeks but failed to sustain that momentum. Got booked for tugging back Dwight McNeil. 6

**Diogo Dalot**

A more purposeful presence on the left-hand side though his end product was often lacking. A gradual improvement this week. 6

**Bruno Fernandes**

Assisted both first-half goals, although he seemed to overhit the pass that Zirkzee finished as it seemed intended for Amad. Came off for a rest with the game won. 7

**Marcus Rashford**

Put United ahead with a sweetly-timed half-volley that deflected in off Branthwaite and made the right run to finish Amad's pass. 7

**Joshua Zirkzee**

Got his first club goal in 18 games by salvaging Fernandes's overhit pass to make it 2-0 and had a key role in the third goal before coolly making it 4-0. 8

**Subs**

**Luke Shaw**

Got more fulfilling minutes in third sub appearance running. 6

**Harry Maguire**

Back in the team for the first time in eight weeks. 6

**Alejandro Garnacho**

Embarked on some energetic bursts. 6

**Manuel Ugarte**

Coasted through the final quarter. 6

**Mason Mount**

Last to come on. 6

Ruben Amorim makes Marcus Rashford claim after Manchester United win
====================================================================

Marcus Rashford scored twice in Man Utd's comfortable win over Everton and Ruben Amorim was asked about his display.

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Ruben Amorim agreed Marcus Rashford showed "he wanted it" by scoring a brace in Manchester United's dominant 4-0 victory over Everton on Sunday.

Amorim said when asked about Rashford at his press conference last week: "We'll try to find the right solution for him but he has to be Marcus, first of all, to try to return to that moment."

Amorim was asked whether Rashford's performance against Everton was an example of him "wanting it" and responded: "Yeah, yeah... he can do so much. He has to continue to improve.

"He has the ability to do that but he can play so much better, like the other guys. It was a good performance, tomorrow he has to recover and start thinking about Arsenal."

Zirkzee also scored twice on Sunday and Amorim discussed his display. "First thing, I need all the players to cope with all the games and he’s one of them. I just try to put my players in good positions for their characteristics," he said.

"It would have been really hard, even for Rasmus \[Hojlund\], to fight with the two centre-backs of Everton, so we try and push them to a position that they weren’t so comfortable and Josh did a great job.

"He scored two goals, which is always important for the confidence. But more important than that was his performance because he fought in every situation. It was a good day for him and our team."

United's win against Everton moved them into the top half of the table. "I understand that it’s hard for me to say no because you would say I can’t be a [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) coach, but I want to be honest with our fans," said Amorim about potential [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) qualification.

Former Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea has sent hopeful prayers the way of his Fiorentina teammate Edoardo Bove after he collapsed during Sunday's match against Inter. The game was suspended after 25 minutes with Bove stretchered off and taken to hospital.

De Gea, who joined the Italian side over the summer and has played 10 times in Serie A alongside Bove, started the game. [He was among those who were extremely worried on the field after Bove fell to the ground.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fiorentina-vs-inter-suspended-david-30492772)

Writing on X (formerly Twitter), De Gea said, "God Please (prayer hands emoji\]". Players were taken from the pitch by the referee after Bove was removed from the stadium.

A group of medical staff and members of both teams formed a wall to block any view of Bove during the distressing incident. Some were left in tears and putting their hands on their head and over their eyes.

It has been reported in Italy that Bove is breathing on his own in hospital. The game has since been abandoned and will be rescheduled.

Bove, 22, is on loan from Roma and joined Fiorentina over the summer like De Gea. The ex-United shot-stopper moved to Italy as a free agent after not finding a club upon his exit from [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

The Serie A X account also posted a message to Bove. It wrote: "Forza Edo. Siamo con te!" alongside an image of the player. It translates to: "Come on Edo. We are with you!"

Fellow ex-Manchester United star Paul Pogba was among others to offer their support. "Forza @edo\_bove \[prayer hands emoji\]" he wrote on his Instagram story with a blank background. Former [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) striker Mario Balotelli did the same. He wrote: "@edo\_bove Prego di rivederti così al più presto Ti abbraccio forte \[bicep emoji\]", which translates as, "I pray to see you again as soon as possible I hug you tightly."

Romelu Lukaku and Tammy Abraham, who were both at Roma last season but now play at Napoli and AC Milan respectively, have also posted to their Instagram stories for Bove.

Bove has played 11 league games for La Viola this season, winning the last seven he has started alongside De Gea. The pair have only failed to win twice when playing together, only one was a defeat.

![Image 1](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491380.ece/ALTERNATES/s1200/0_GettyImages-2187193355.jpg)

Manchester United recorded their biggest Premier League win of the season by beating Everton 4-0 at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee, who started together for the first time under Ruben Amorim, helped themself to a brace each to put Everton to the sword and elevate United up into the top half of the Premier League table.

Rashford gave United a 34th-minute lead, firing a deflected effort past Everton goalkeeper Jordan Pickford, before Zirkzee scored his first goal since the opening weekend of the season seven minutes later.

United put the game beyond doubt less than 30 seconds into the second half when Rashford claimed his second, firing past Pickford after being slipped in by the lively Amad.

Amad then created United's fourth goal that was turned in by Zirkzee for his second goal of the afternoon.

The only negative for United was that they lost both Lisandro Martinez and Kobbie Mainoo to suspension. They were both yellow carded in the second half, each collecting their fifth booking of the season in the process.

**You can recap how Sunday afternoon's game unfolded by scanning through our blog below...**

15:44KEY EVENT

### REPORT: Amad responds perfectly to Amorim's touchline reactions in United win

Jarrad Branthwaite did not get his move to United in the summer yet he stepped up as their 12th man against Everton.

A deflection and a dozy pass from the centre back gifted United both of their first-half goals to turn the game on its head. Branthwaite skulked off at half-time with his head bowed, tugging his shirt in the hope it would be big enough to conceal his embarrassed expression. There was a half left to play yet Everton were done.

United were otherwise unconvincing in a first half so troubling that Ruben Amorim was plotting a double substitution at half-time. Branthwaite's collapse caused his teammates to also fold. United ran away with it without running much.

After two 3-0 reverses at Old Trafford, the thrashings are being meted out by the home side. There was a hearty and celebratory rendition of "Amorim's Red and White Army" from the Stretford End before the hour, with victory already assured. This was United's first four-goal victory in the Premier League since the opening day of the 2021-22 season.

### PLAYER RATINGS: Amad brilliant as United put Everton to the sword

United recorded their biggest Premier League victory of the season with a 4-0 win over Everton at Old Trafford this afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee each helped themselves to a brace, both scoring either side of half-time, to secure the first Premier League win of the Ruben Amorim era.

Here is a flavour of how Samuel Luckhurst rated United's players out of 10...

**Andre Onana**

Didn't do anything wrong during a difficult first half for United and had a much quieter second 45 minutes as he kept a clean sheet. Saved late on from Dominic Calvert-Lewin. 7

**Noussair Mazraoui**

Had a more testing time against Iliman Ndiaye but came through it to help keep United's sheet clean before he was rested. 6

**Matthijs de Ligt**

Outpaced by Beto for Everton's best chance with the game goalless as he failed to dominate another defender-striker duel. Came off before the hour. 5

### 43' - MUN 2-0 EFC - United are well on top now

That deflection has turned the game on its head and United should run away with this now. All of Zirkzee's teammates are pleased as punch for him. It's his first goal in 18 games and second in 19. He had not looked like getting a sniff until he slid in there but it was well-taken after Fernandes seized on Branthwaite's sloppiness.

Branthwaite, so solid at the start, has become a 12th man for United.

Manchester United vs Everton highlights and reaction as Rashford and Zirkzee score in big win
=============================================================================================

A full recap of the key events from Man United's 4-0 win over Everton at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Samuel Luckhurst](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/samuel-luckhurst/)Chief Manchester United writer

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491380.ece/ALTERNATES/s1200/0_GettyImages-2187193355.jpg)

Manchester United recorded their biggest Premier League win of the season by beating Everton 4-0 at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee, who started together for the first time under Ruben Amorim, helped themself to a brace each to put Everton to the sword and elevate United up into the top half of the Premier League table.

Rashford gave United a 34th-minute lead, firing a deflected effort past Everton goalkeeper Jordan Pickford, before Zirkzee scored his first goal since the opening weekend of the season seven minutes later.

United put the game beyond doubt less than 30 seconds into the second half when Rashford claimed his second, firing past Pickford after being slipped in by the lively Amad.

Amad then created United's fourth goal that was turned in by Zirkzee for his second goal of the afternoon.

The only negative for United was that they lost both Lisandro Martinez and Kobbie Mainoo to suspension. They were both yellow carded in the second half, each collecting their fifth booking of the season in the process.

**You can recap how Sunday afternoon's game unfolded by scanning through our blog below...**

Key Events

15:44KEY EVENT

### REPORT: Amad responds perfectly to Amorim's touchline reactions in United win

Jarrad Branthwaite did not get his move to United in the summer yet he stepped up as their 12th man against Everton.

A deflection and a dozy pass from the centre back gifted United both of their first-half goals to turn the game on its head. Branthwaite skulked off at half-time with his head bowed, tugging his shirt in the hope it would be big enough to conceal his embarrassed expression. There was a half left to play yet Everton were done.

United were otherwise unconvincing in a first half so troubling that Ruben Amorim was plotting a double substitution at half-time. Branthwaite's collapse caused his teammates to also fold. United ran away with it without running much.

After two 3-0 reverses at Old Trafford, the thrashings are being meted out by the home side. There was a hearty and celebratory rendition of "Amorim's Red and White Army" from the Stretford End before the hour, with victory already assured. This was United's first four-goal victory in the Premier League since the opening day of the 2021-22 season.

### PLAYER RATINGS: Amad brilliant as United put Everton to the sword

United recorded their biggest Premier League victory of the season with a 4-0 win over Everton at Old Trafford this afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee each helped themselves to a brace, both scoring either side of half-time, to secure the first Premier League win of the Ruben Amorim era.

Here is a flavour of how Samuel Luckhurst rated United's players out of 10...

**Andre Onana**

Didn't do anything wrong during a difficult first half for United and had a much quieter second 45 minutes as he kept a clean sheet. Saved late on from Dominic Calvert-Lewin. 7

**Noussair Mazraoui**

Had a more testing time against Iliman Ndiaye but came through it to help keep United's sheet clean before he was rested. 6

**Matthijs de Ligt**

Outpaced by Beto for Everton's best chance with the game goalless as he failed to dominate another defender-striker duel. Came off before the hour. 5

Manchester United vs Everton highlights and reaction as Rashford and Zirkzee score in big win
=============================================================================================

A full recap of the key events from Man United's 4-0 win over Everton at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.

[Samuel Luckhurst](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/samuel-luckhurst/)Chief Manchester United writer

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491380.ece/ALTERNATES/s1200/0_GettyImages-2187193355.jpg)

Manchester United recorded their biggest Premier League win of the season by beating Everton 4-0 at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee, who started together for the first time under Ruben Amorim, helped themself to a brace each to put Everton to the sword and elevate United up into the top half of the Premier League table.

Rashford gave United a 34th-minute lead, firing a deflected effort past Everton goalkeeper Jordan Pickford, before Zirkzee scored his first goal since the opening weekend of the season seven minutes later.

United put the game beyond doubt less than 30 seconds into the second half when Rashford claimed his second, firing past Pickford after being slipped in by the lively Amad.

Amad then created United's fourth goal that was turned in by Zirkzee for his second goal of the afternoon.

The only negative for United was that they lost both Lisandro Martinez and Kobbie Mainoo to suspension. They were both yellow carded in the second half, each collecting their fifth booking of the season in the process.

**You can recap how Sunday afternoon's game unfolded by scanning through our blog below...**

15:44KEY EVENT

### REPORT: Amad responds perfectly to Amorim's touchline reactions in United win

Jarrad Branthwaite did not get his move to United in the summer yet he stepped up as their 12th man against Everton.

A deflection and a dozy pass from the centre back gifted United both of their first-half goals to turn the game on its head. Branthwaite skulked off at half-time with his head bowed, tugging his shirt in the hope it would be big enough to conceal his embarrassed expression. There was a half left to play yet Everton were done.

United were otherwise unconvincing in a first half so troubling that Ruben Amorim was plotting a double substitution at half-time. Branthwaite's collapse caused his teammates to also fold. United ran away with it without running much.

After two 3-0 reverses at Old Trafford, the thrashings are being meted out by the home side. There was a hearty and celebratory rendition of "Amorim's Red and White Army" from the Stretford End before the hour, with victory already assured. This was United's first four-goal victory in the Premier League since the opening day of the 2021-22 season.

15:28KEY EVENT

### PLAYER RATINGS: Amad brilliant as United put Everton to the sword

United recorded their biggest Premier League victory of the season with a 4-0 win over Everton at Old Trafford this afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee each helped themselves to a brace, both scoring either side of half-time, to secure the first Premier League win of the Ruben Amorim era.

Here is a flavour of how Samuel Luckhurst rated United's players out of 10...

**Andre Onana**

Didn't do anything wrong during a difficult first half for United and had a much quieter second 45 minutes as he kept a clean sheet. Saved late on from Dominic Calvert-Lewin. 7

**Noussair Mazraoui**

Had a more testing time against Iliman Ndiaye but came through it to help keep United's sheet clean before he was rested. 6

**Matthijs de Ligt**

Outpaced by Beto for Everton's best chance with the game goalless as he failed to dominate another defender-striker duel. Came off before the hour. 5

Manchester United vs Everton highlights and reaction as Rashford and Zirkzee score in big win
=============================================================================================

A full recap of the key events from Man United's 4-0 win over Everton at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491380.ece/ALTERNATES/s1200/0_GettyImages-2187193355.jpg)

Manchester United recorded their biggest Premier League win of the season by beating Everton 4-0 at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee, who started together for the first time under Ruben Amorim, helped themself to a brace each to put Everton to the sword and elevate United up into the top half of the Premier League table.

Rashford gave United a 34th-minute lead, firing a deflected effort past Everton goalkeeper Jordan Pickford, before Zirkzee scored his first goal since the opening weekend of the season seven minutes later.

United put the game beyond doubt less than 30 seconds into the second half when Rashford claimed his second, firing past Pickford after being slipped in by the lively Amad.

Amad then created United's fourth goal that was turned in by Zirkzee for his second goal of the afternoon.

The only negative for United was that they lost both Lisandro Martinez and Kobbie Mainoo to suspension. They were both yellow carded in the second half, each collecting their fifth booking of the season in the process.

**You can recap how Sunday afternoon's game unfolded by scanning through our blog below...**

15:44KEY EVENT

### REPORT: Amad responds perfectly to Amorim's touchline reactions in United win

Jarrad Branthwaite did not get his move to United in the summer yet he stepped up as their 12th man against Everton.

A deflection and a dozy pass from the centre back gifted United both of their first-half goals to turn the game on its head. Branthwaite skulked off at half-time with his head bowed, tugging his shirt in the hope it would be big enough to conceal his embarrassed expression. There was a half left to play yet Everton were done.

United were otherwise unconvincing in a first half so troubling that Ruben Amorim was plotting a double substitution at half-time. Branthwaite's collapse caused his teammates to also fold. United ran away with it without running much.

After two 3-0 reverses at Old Trafford, the thrashings are being meted out by the home side. There was a hearty and celebratory rendition of "Amorim's Red and White Army" from the Stretford End before the hour, with victory already assured. This was United's first four-goal victory in the Premier League since the opening day of the 2021-22 season.

15:28KEY EVENT

### PLAYER RATINGS: Amad brilliant as United put Everton to the sword

United recorded their biggest Premier League victory of the season with a 4-0 win over Everton at Old Trafford this afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee each helped themselves to a brace, both scoring either side of half-time, to secure the first Premier League win of the Ruben Amorim era.

Here is a flavour of how Samuel Luckhurst rated United's players out of 10...

**Andre Onana**

Didn't do anything wrong during a difficult first half for United and had a much quieter second 45 minutes as he kept a clean sheet. Saved late on from Dominic Calvert-Lewin. 7

**Noussair Mazraoui**

Had a more testing time against Iliman Ndiaye but came through it to help keep United's sheet clean before he was rested. 6

**Matthijs de Ligt**

Outpaced by Beto for Everton's best chance with the game goalless as he failed to dominate another defender-striker duel. Came off before the hour. 5

15:22KEY EVENT

### FULL-TIME: MUN 4-0 EFC - A big win for United!

It's all over here at Old Trafford and United have recorded their biggest Premier League win of the season, scoring four goals without reply.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee netted a brace apiece to move United into the top half of the table.

Next up: Arsenal (A) on Wednesday night.

'Bitter and resentful' ticket hikes slammed as Man United, Man City and Liverpool unite
=======================================================================================

Supporters from Manchester City, Man United, Everton and Liverpool came together to protest ticket hikes
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/bitter-resentful-ticket-hikes-slammed-30492281#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Tyrone Marshall](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/tyrone-marshall/)Senior Football Writer

[Stephen Killen](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/stephen-killen/)Senior Football Writer

*   16:51, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Fans of Manchester United are seen with a #Stop Exploiting Loyalty banner in protest against ticket prices during the Premier League match against Everton at Old Trafford](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30491949.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United.jpg)

Fans of Manchester United are seen with a #Stop Exploiting Loyalty banner in protest against ticket prices during the Premier League match against Everton at Old Trafford (Image: Gareth Copley/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

The price increases from Premier League clubs has been described as 'death by a thousand cuts' with [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) Fans Supporting Foodbanks' Nick Clarke expressing his hope for change within English football.

Fans from both [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) and Manchester joined forces on Sunday to protest against ticket price increases. [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and Everton were together in arms prior to United's 4-0 win in a demonstration against hikes amid recent changes from the [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) hierarchy which will see new tickets for children and older fans rise to £66.

At Anfield, fans displayed a 'Stop Exploiting Loyalty' and 'Unity is Strength' banners outside of the Kop against the soaring yearly costs. Clarke said: "Tribalism ultimately holds back supporters across the country, who all experience the same issues to getting things done from protecting the game, as we know and knew it.

**READ MORE: [Player ratings as Amad brilliant vs Everton](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30490967)**

**READ MORE: [Why Ederson is on Man City bench as Stefan Ortega starts and Pep Guardiola explains Liverpool call](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ederson-man-city-bench-stefan-30491631)**

"Spirit of Shankly reached out to us, we looked at the fixture list and United were playing Everton at home on the same day, the four biggest clubs in the north west, all together. We reached out to United fans, for me as a City fan, all the hatred and bitterness that exists between our two clubs, to reach out to United was a tough thing to do but the 1958 group were absolutely fantastic.

"They understand we can hate each other in the stand to an extent but we will not get anything done outside of it. I want to be there in the same stands in 20 years slagging them off, I want my sons, daughters, nieces and nephews to also be there - it doesn't seem possible with the way football is going now.

"During a time where fans feel downbeat and depressed, it's not like a one off issue, Villa putting the prices up for [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) tickets but at City, we've experienced 12 out of 14 seasons price increases - it's death by a thousand cuts, that's what hurts, it's bitter and resentful. It affects us over years, now I've never felt like this before, speaking to Liverpool and United fans, the way we are now I feel so hopeful.

"English football needs to change, this (protesting) is how we'll change it through the fans - who people say are the lifeblood of the game but none of them act like it."

Spirit of Shankly's Gareth Roberts added: "Man City have been one of our huge rivals on the pitch in recent years and we thought it sent a really strong message to come together today before a huge game and say we've had enough. Because we have had enough - Liverpool fans have, City fans have, United fans, Everton fans have, fans across the league feel they've been squeezed too much now.

"We've been squeezed for 30 years, let's be honest, I want to send a message, we all want to send a message to the clubs to stop putting the prices up, stop exploiting our loyalty and it's at every turn.

"Manchester United this week, £66 tickets, one minute it's £25 for an under-16, next it's £66, clearly not acceptable but clearly an example of boardrooms that don't really seem to care about the fans so we're saying, 'you should care'.

"Where will that lead? That will lead, I think, to a 'product' where you've got people coming, tick it off the bucket list, watch a game, look at the famous Kop and wonder why it's not that noisy and not that passionate anymore then go home and say, 'well, it's not what I heard it was'.

"Why isn't it? Because you price people out. All we're saying is keep the game affordable, there's £12.25billion coming into the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) in TV money over the next three years, that sounds like enough where you don't have to keep putting your hands out to fans."

'Bitter and resentful' ticket hikes slammed as Man United, Man City and Liverpool unite
=======================================================================================

Supporters from Manchester City, Man United, Everton and Liverpool came together to protest ticket hikes
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![Image 1: Fans of Manchester United are seen with a #Stop Exploiting Loyalty banner in protest against ticket prices during the Premier League match against Everton at Old Trafford](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30491949.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United.jpg)

Fans of Manchester United are seen with a #Stop Exploiting Loyalty banner in protest against ticket prices during the Premier League match against Everton at Old Trafford (Image: Gareth Copley/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

The price increases from Premier League clubs has been described as 'death by a thousand cuts' with [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) Fans Supporting Foodbanks' Nick Clarke expressing his hope for change within English football.

Fans from both [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) and Manchester joined forces on Sunday to protest against ticket price increases. [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and Everton were together in arms prior to United's 4-0 win in a demonstration against hikes amid recent changes from the [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) hierarchy which will see new tickets for children and older fans rise to £66.

At Anfield, fans displayed a 'Stop Exploiting Loyalty' and 'Unity is Strength' banners outside of the Kop against the soaring yearly costs. Clarke said: "Tribalism ultimately holds back supporters across the country, who all experience the same issues to getting things done from protecting the game, as we know and knew it.

**READ MORE: [Player ratings as Amad brilliant vs Everton](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30490967)**

**READ MORE: [Why Ederson is on Man City bench as Stefan Ortega starts and Pep Guardiola explains Liverpool call](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ederson-man-city-bench-stefan-30491631)**

"Spirit of Shankly reached out to us, we looked at the fixture list and United were playing Everton at home on the same day, the four biggest clubs in the north west, all together. We reached out to United fans, for me as a City fan, all the hatred and bitterness that exists between our two clubs, to reach out to United was a tough thing to do but the 1958 group were absolutely fantastic.

"They understand we can hate each other in the stand to an extent but we will not get anything done outside of it. I want to be there in the same stands in 20 years slagging them off, I want my sons, daughters, nieces and nephews to also be there - it doesn't seem possible with the way football is going now.

"During a time where fans feel downbeat and depressed, it's not like a one off issue, Villa putting the prices up for [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) tickets but at City, we've experienced 12 out of 14 seasons price increases - it's death by a thousand cuts, that's what hurts, it's bitter and resentful. It affects us over years, now I've never felt like this before, speaking to Liverpool and United fans, the way we are now I feel so hopeful.

"English football needs to change, this (protesting) is how we'll change it through the fans - who people say are the lifeblood of the game but none of them act like it."

Spirit of Shankly's Gareth Roberts added: "Man City have been one of our huge rivals on the pitch in recent years and we thought it sent a really strong message to come together today before a huge game and say we've had enough. Because we have had enough - Liverpool fans have, City fans have, United fans, Everton fans have, fans across the league feel they've been squeezed too much now.

"We've been squeezed for 30 years, let's be honest, I want to send a message, we all want to send a message to the clubs to stop putting the prices up, stop exploiting our loyalty and it's at every turn.

"Manchester United this week, £66 tickets, one minute it's £25 for an under-16, next it's £66, clearly not acceptable but clearly an example of boardrooms that don't really seem to care about the fans so we're saying, 'you should care'.

"Where will that lead? That will lead, I think, to a 'product' where you've got people coming, tick it off the bucket list, watch a game, look at the famous Kop and wonder why it's not that noisy and not that passionate anymore then go home and say, 'well, it's not what I heard it was'.

"Why isn't it? Because you price people out. All we're saying is keep the game affordable, there's £12.25billion coming into the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) in TV money over the next three years, that sounds like enough where you don't have to keep putting your hands out to fans."

data: {"title":"'Resentful' ticket hikes slammed as Man Utd, City and Liverpool protest","description":"Supporters from Manchester City, Man United, Everton and Liverpool came together to protest ticket hikes","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/bitter-resentful-ticket-hikes-slammed-30492281","content":"'Bitter and resentful' ticket hikes slammed as Man United, Man City and Liverpool unite - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

'Bitter and resentful' ticket hikes slammed as Man United, Man City and Liverpool unite
=======================================================================================

Supporters from Manchester City, Man United, Everton and Liverpool came together to protest ticket hikes
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*

*   [Comments4](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/bitter-resentful-ticket-hikes-slammed-30492281#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Tyrone Marshall](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/tyrone-marshall/)Senior Football Writer

[Stephen Killen](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/stephen-killen/)Senior Football Writer

*   16:51, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Fans of Manchester United are seen with a #Stop Exploiting Loyalty banner in protest against ticket prices during the Premier League match against Everton at Old Trafford](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30491949.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United.jpg)

Fans of Manchester United are seen with a #Stop Exploiting Loyalty banner in protest against ticket prices during the Premier League match against Everton at Old Trafford (Image: Gareth Copley/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

The price increases from Premier League clubs has been described as 'death by a thousand cuts' with [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) Fans Supporting Foodbanks' Nick Clarke expressing his hope for change within English football.

Fans from both [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) and Manchester joined forces on Sunday to protest against ticket price increases. [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and Everton were together in arms prior to United's 4-0 win in a demonstration against hikes amid recent changes from the [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) hierarchy which will see new tickets for children and older fans rise to £66.

At Anfield, fans displayed a 'Stop Exploiting Loyalty' and 'Unity is Strength' banners outside of the Kop against the soaring yearly costs. Clarke said: "Tribalism ultimately holds back supporters across the country, who all experience the same issues to getting things done from protecting the game, as we know and knew it.

**READ MORE: [Player ratings as Amad brilliant vs Everton](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30490967)**

**READ MORE: [Why Ederson is on Man City bench as Stefan Ortega starts and Pep Guardiola explains Liverpool call](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ederson-man-city-bench-stefan-30491631)**

"Spirit of Shankly reached out to us, we looked at the fixture list and United were playing Everton at home on the same day, the four biggest clubs in the north west, all together. We reached out to United fans, for me as a City fan, all the hatred and bitterness that exists between our two clubs, to reach out to United was a tough thing to do but the 1958 group were absolutely fantastic.

"They understand we can hate each other in the stand to an extent but we will not get anything done outside of it. I want to be there in the same stands in 20 years slagging them off, I want my sons, daughters, nieces and nephews to also be there - it doesn't seem possible with the way football is going now.

"During a time where fans feel downbeat and depressed, it's not like a one off issue, Villa putting the prices up for [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) tickets but at City, we've experienced 12 out of 14 seasons price increases - it's death by a thousand cuts, that's what hurts, it's bitter and resentful. It affects us over years, now I've never felt like this before, speaking to Liverpool and United fans, the way we are now I feel so hopeful.

"English football needs to change, this (protesting) is how we'll change it through the fans - who people say are the lifeblood of the game but none of them act like it."

Spirit of Shankly's Gareth Roberts added: "Man City have been one of our huge rivals on the pitch in recent years and we thought it sent a really strong message to come together today before a huge game and say we've had enough. Because we have had enough - Liverpool fans have, City fans have, United fans, Everton fans have, fans across the league feel they've been squeezed too much now.

"We've been squeezed for 30 years, let's be honest, I want to send a message, we all want to send a message to the clubs to stop putting the prices up, stop exploiting our loyalty and it's at every turn.

"Manchester United this week, £66 tickets, one minute it's £25 for an under-16, next it's £66, clearly not acceptable but clearly an example of boardrooms that don't really seem to care about the fans so we're saying, 'you should care'.

"Where will that lead? That will lead, I think, to a 'product' where you've got people coming, tick it off the bucket list, watch a game, look at the famous Kop and wonder why it's not that noisy and not that passionate anymore then go home and say, 'well, it's not what I heard it was'.

"Why isn't it? Because you price people out. All we're saying is keep the game affordable, there's £12.25billion coming into the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) in TV money over the next three years, that sounds like enough where you don't have to keep putting your hands out to fans."

'Bitter and resentful' ticket hikes slammed as Man United, Man City and Liverpool unite

Supporters from Manchester City, Man United, Everton and Liverpool came together to protest ticket hikes

The price increases from Premier League clubs has been described as 'death by a thousand cuts' with [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) Fans Supporting Foodbanks' Nick Clarke expressing his hope for change within English football.

Fans from both [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) and Manchester joined forces on Sunday to protest against ticket price increases. [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and Everton were together in arms prior to United's 4-0 win in a demonstration against hikes amid recent changes from the [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) hierarchy which will see new tickets for children and older fans rise to £66.

At Anfield, fans displayed a 'Stop Exploiting Loyalty' and 'Unity is Strength' banners outside of the Kop against the soaring yearly costs. Clarke said: "Tribalism ultimately holds back supporters across the country, who all experience the same issues to getting things done from protecting the game, as we know and knew it.

**READ MORE: [Player ratings as Amad brilliant vs Everton](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30490967)**

**READ MORE: [Why Ederson is on Man City bench as Stefan Ortega starts and Pep Guardiola explains Liverpool call](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ederson-man-city-bench-stefan-30491631)**

"Spirit of Shankly reached out to us, we looked at the fixture list and United were playing Everton at home on the same day, the four biggest clubs in the north west, all together. We reached out to United fans, for me as a City fan, all the hatred and bitterness that exists between our two clubs, to reach out to United was a tough thing to do but the 1958 group were absolutely fantastic.

"They understand we can hate each other in the stand to an extent but we will not get anything done outside of it. I want to be there in the same stands in 20 years slagging them off, I want my sons, daughters, nieces and nephews to also be there - it doesn't seem possible with the way football is going now.

"During a time where fans feel downbeat and depressed, it's not like a one off issue, Villa putting the prices up for [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) tickets but at City, we've experienced 12 out of 14 seasons price increases - it's death by a thousand cuts, that's what hurts, it's bitter and resentful. It affects us over years, now I've never felt like this before, speaking to Liverpool and United fans, the way we are now I feel so hopeful.

"English football needs to change, this (protesting) is how we'll change it through the fans - who people say are the lifeblood of the game but none of them act like it."

Spirit of Shankly's Gareth Roberts added: "Man City have been one of our huge rivals on the pitch in recent years and we thought it sent a really strong message to come together today before a huge game and say we've had enough. Because we have had enough - Liverpool fans have, City fans have, United fans, Everton fans have, fans across the league feel they've been squeezed too much now.

"We've been squeezed for 30 years, let's be honest, I want to send a message, we all want to send a message to the clubs to stop putting the prices up, stop exploiting our loyalty and it's at every turn.

"Manchester United this week, £66 tickets, one minute it's £25 for an under-16, next it's £66, clearly not acceptable but clearly an example of boardrooms that don't really seem to care about the fans so we're saying, 'you should care'.

"Where will that lead? That will lead, I think, to a 'product' where you've got people coming, tick it off the bucket list, watch a game, look at the famous Kop and wonder why it's not that noisy and not that passionate anymore then go home and say, 'well, it's not what I heard it was'.

"Why isn't it? Because you price people out. All we're saying is keep the game affordable, there's £12.25billion coming into the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) in TV money over the next three years, that sounds like enough where you don't have to keep putting your hands out to fans."

Kobbie Mainoo and Leny Yoro agree with one-word Amad verdict after Man United win
=================================================================================

Manchester United recorded back-to-back victories with a thumping 4-0 win over Everton in the Premier League
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Manchester United stars Kobbie Mainoo and Leny Yoro have hailed the impact of Amad after he grabbed two assists in the 4-0 victory over Everton.

[The Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) returned to [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) after an unconvincing win over Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) but United were a lot closer to what Ruben Amorim is wanting on Sunday afternoon. Marcus Rashford opened the scoring with a deflected effort before Joshua Zirkzee scored after the ball was initially won back well by [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo).

United made it three with [Rashford's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) second of the game as the Ivorian laid the ball through for him and the game was wrapped up by Zirkzee just after the hour mark as Amad once again won possession high up the pitch before setting up the Dutchman for his brace.

**READ MORE: [United player ratings vs Everton](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30490967)**

**READ MORE: [Amad responds perfectly to Amorim's touchline reaction](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/amad-responds-perfectly-ruben-amorims-30490976)**

It was a performance from Amad that many [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) fans have come to expect after becoming a key player quickly under Amorim. After the match, United's official Instagram posted a picture of the winger with the caption: "Unplayable."

This was quickly shared on Mainoo's story and liked by Yoro as they sent a clear verdict on the youngster's performance. Amad's brace of assists made it four in just three [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) matches for United.

  

![Image 3: Kobbie Mainoo shares his verdict on Amad](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30492522.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_Screenshot-2024-12-01-164205.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo shares his verdict on Amad after Man United's defeat of Everton

Since Amorim arrived, Amad has been asked to play a wing-back role, one which he has taken to comfortably. During much of Erik ten Hag's reign, Antony was chosen ahead of the 22-year-old much to the bemusement of supporters.

However, the winger is now one of the first names on the teamsheet. Next up for Amad and his United teammates is a trip to Arsenal in midweek in the Premier League.

data: {"title":"Kobbie Mainoo and Leny Yoro agree with one-word verdict after Man United win","description":"Manchester United recorded back-to-back victories with a thumping 4-0 win over Everton in the Premier League","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/kobbie-mainoo-leny-yoro-agree-30492425","content":"Kobbie Mainoo and Leny Yoro agree with one-word Amad verdict after Man United win - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Kobbie Mainoo and Leny Yoro agree with one-word Amad verdict after Man United win
=================================================================================

Manchester United recorded back-to-back victories with a thumping 4-0 win over Everton in the Premier League
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments1](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/kobbie-mainoo-leny-yoro-agree-30492425#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   17:04, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Kobbie Mainoo applauds the Manchester United supporters](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30492537.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187706265.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo applauds the Manchester United supporters during the game against Everton (Image: Ash Donelon/Manchester United via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United stars Kobbie Mainoo and Leny Yoro have hailed the impact of Amad after he grabbed two assists in the 4-0 victory over Everton.

[The Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) returned to [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) after an unconvincing win over Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) but United were a lot closer to what Ruben Amorim is wanting on Sunday afternoon. Marcus Rashford opened the scoring with a deflected effort before Joshua Zirkzee scored after the ball was initially won back well by [Amad](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/amad-diallo).

United made it three with [Rashford's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) second of the game as the Ivorian laid the ball through for him and the game was wrapped up by Zirkzee just after the hour mark as Amad once again won possession high up the pitch before setting up the Dutchman for his brace.

**READ MORE: [United player ratings vs Everton](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30490967)**

**READ MORE: [Amad responds perfectly to Amorim's touchline reaction](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/amad-responds-perfectly-ruben-amorims-30490976)**

It was a performance from Amad that many [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) fans have come to expect after becoming a key player quickly under Amorim. After the match, United's official Instagram posted a picture of the winger with the caption: "Unplayable."

This was quickly shared on Mainoo's story and liked by Yoro as they sent a clear verdict on the youngster's performance. Amad's brace of assists made it four in just three [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) matches for United.

  

![Image 3: Kobbie Mainoo shares his verdict on Amad](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30492522.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_Screenshot-2024-12-01-164205.jpg)

Kobbie Mainoo shares his verdict on Amad after Man United's defeat of Everton

Since Amorim arrived, Amad has been asked to play a wing-back role, one which he has taken to comfortably. During much of Erik ten Hag's reign, Antony was chosen ahead of the 22-year-old much to the bemusement of supporters.

However, the winger is now one of the first names on the teamsheet. Next up for Amad and his United teammates is a trip to Arsenal in midweek in the Premier League.
