[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

'More natural' - Ruben Amorim sent Man United demand for Everton Premier League clash
=====================================================================================

Manchester United will hope to continue a winning streak against the Toffees with Ruben Amorim's first Premier League home game in charge of the Reds
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments1](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/more-natural-ruben-amorim-sent-30488029#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

Thomas FairCommunity Editor

Manchester Evening News readers

*   16:16, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim during a Manchester United game](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30488083.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/1_Ruben-Amorim.jpg)

MEN readers have been telling Ruben Amorim what team to pick for Manchester United's game against Everton (Image: Robbie Jay Barratt - AMA/Getty Image)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United will be hoping to continue a winning streak against Everton on Sunday - and Manchester Evening News readers in [our comments section](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/sport-opinion/call-more-natural-positions-manchester-30488029#comments-wrapper) have been trying their hand at building the perfect line-up for the match.

United will welcome the Toffees to [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) off the back of Ruben Amorim's first win, with Rasmus Hojlund scoring a brace to beat Bodo/Glimt from behind. Amorim has yet to get off the mark in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league), after drawing 1-1 with Ipswich in his first outing.

The busy winter period looms, and there is likely to be plenty of rotation - both for tired legs, and for settling into Amorim's preferred 3-4-3 formation. [Goalkeeper Andre Onana will keep his nailed-on Premier League position](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-predicted-line-up-30485990), but who else should feature?

Reader Jungle Jerry writes: “I would play Shaw at LWB and Dalot at RWB. Rest Fernandes. Play Amad and Mount behind Højlund. Mazraoui, De Ligt, and Martinez keep their places in the backline, with Ugarte and Mainoo in midfield. More natural positions for players and more energy.”

Commenter Tankjr would try something different, replying: “If playing a less physical team with less counter-attacking pace, or using a different formation that would seem like a really good starting 11, assuming we could handle resting captain fantastic, ever.

"But for Everton I would stick Dalot at RWB, with Malacia in the LWB position, drop Shaw in behind as the dedicated Left CB, Maguire at CB, stick with Mazroui at Right RB. Play De Ligt as a sweeper DMF in front of the back three, then Ugarte or Mainoo as a DMF/CMF level with the wingback midfield line. Bruno at AMF, Mount as Split Striker and Hojlund up top as the CF, to offset being too short and lightweight with the six attackers.”

[**READ MORE**: Ruben Amorim could unleash new midfield vs Everton to give Manchester United fans what they want](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-could-unleash-new-30486680)

[**READ MORE**: Ruben Amorim gives Tyrell Malacia verdict and provides Manchester United injury update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-gives-tyrell-malacia-30487790)

Ben123456 says: ”Would rather see Bruno continuing to play the deeper role alongside Ugarte. Then you have someone destructive (Ugarte) to break up play and someone that can start attacks and pass FORWARD (Bruno). Also would then mean you play 2 from 3 of Mainoo, Mount and Garnacho playing off Hojlund. Mainoo’s greatest strengths are his ability to receive the ball in tight spaces, close control and dribbling. Amad to continue as the more attacking of the two wingbacks, and with Mazraoui behind him, you have a RCB who is comfortable drifting wider in coverage.

"LWB is still a problem as Dalot tends to want to drift inside, Malacia looked leggy in the week (to be expected given how long he’s been out), and Shaw may be technically the best option his durability as a LB has been terrible. LWB definitely the first area to prioritise when it comes to transfers, followed by a pacy CB as our current CBs don’t have a lot of pace. (Evans and Lindelof almost certainly gone in the summer and arguably Maguire could well be to for the same reason - he’s SLOW).”

Bruno Fernandes' continued inclusion remains a talking point for some. Reader Rubes1177 writes: “As good as Fernandes is at times, I think overall he is going to hold this team back playing this formation. He is too much of a luxury player. We need someone more athletic and strong in the press to fill the position behind the striker and I'm afraid he is not disciplined enough in the deeper roles. Sell him to someone like Barca where I'm sure he will thrive in a slower paced league.”

Zaynaldin says: “120% agree with you man... Rest Bruno for a few games and we'll see. Let Kobbie or Amad take his place.”

**Have your say! Who's safe in this Manchester United team? Who has to prove a point to the new manager? [Comment below, and join in on the conversation](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/sport-opinion/call-more-natural-positions-manchester-30488029#comments-wrapper).**

Erik ten Hag's Man United signing before brutal sacking given green light as true stance emerges
================================================================================================

Erik ten Hag was given the green light to sign one of his former players in the summer and the Manchester United board have been impressed
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By

Matty Hewitt

*   16:30, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Erik ten Hag and Noussair Mazraoui](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article29783812.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2166325398.jpg)

Erik ten Hag signed Noussair Mazraoui in the summer transfer window for Manchester United

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

It's fair to say Erik ten Hag's signings at Manchester United struggled to make a major impact at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford). That was until the arrival of [Noussair Mazraoui](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/noussair-mazraoui-doing-what-manchester-30477349) earlier this summer.

The Moroccan international has been one of the standout performers from a disappointing campaign for the Reds after joining the club from Bayern Munich earlier this summer. The 27-year-old, who worked with [Ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) during their time at Ajax, signed a four-year deal and has been an ever present so far this season.

Signing for a reported initial fee of for an initial fee of £12.8m, that transfer fee now looks like a steal after impressing in his first few months at United. Mazraoui has impressed that much, he's viewed internally as the best signing the club have made in recent years.

**READ MORE: [Sir Jim Ratcliffe and Ineos are betraying Manchester United fans over ticket price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/sir-jim-ratcliffe-ineos-betraying-30480953)**

**READ MORE: [Manchester United predicted line-up vs Everton as new midfield unleashed and Amad recalled](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-predicted-line-up-30485990)**

That's according to Sky Germany's Florian Plettenberg, who claim the Reds 'board and coach coaching staff are extremely satisfied with his performances.'

He tweeted: "Noussair #Mazraoui is internally regarded as one of the strongest signings of recent years at @ManUtd. Both the board and the coaching staff are extremely satisfied with his performances. He is seen as an absolute leader and is expected to continue in this role under Ruben #Amorim in the future. Contract until 2028."

It's very difficult to argue otherwise. The defender has made 19 appearances in all competitions with two assists to his name and is already justifying the transfer fee paid earlier this summer.

On the other hand, it's perhaps indicative of United's recent luck in the transfer window that the defender is viewed as one of the best signings in recent seasons, with the Reds struggling in the bottom half of the table.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) will hope Mazraoui's form continues and is able to help United break into the top-half of the table and push on towards the European places.

Erik ten Hag's Man United signing before brutal sacking given green light as true stance emerges
================================================================================================

Erik ten Hag was given the green light to sign one of his former players in the summer and the Manchester United board have been impressed
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-man-united-30486981#comments-wrapper "Comments")

By

Matty Hewitt

*   16:30, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Erik ten Hag and Noussair Mazraoui](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article29783812.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2166325398.jpg)

Erik ten Hag signed Noussair Mazraoui in the summer transfer window for Manchester United

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

It's fair to say Erik ten Hag's signings at Manchester United struggled to make a major impact at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford). That was until the arrival of [Noussair Mazraoui](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/noussair-mazraoui-doing-what-manchester-30477349) earlier this summer.

The Moroccan international has been one of the standout performers from a disappointing campaign for the Reds after joining the club from Bayern Munich earlier this summer. The 27-year-old, who worked with [Ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) during their time at Ajax, signed a four-year deal and has been an ever present so far this season.

Signing for a reported initial fee of for an initial fee of £12.8m, that transfer fee now looks like a steal after impressing in his first few months at United. Mazraoui has impressed that much, he's viewed internally as the best signing the club have made in recent years.

**READ MORE: [Sir Jim Ratcliffe and Ineos are betraying Manchester United fans over ticket price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/sir-jim-ratcliffe-ineos-betraying-30480953)**

**READ MORE: [Manchester United predicted line-up vs Everton as new midfield unleashed and Amad recalled](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-predicted-line-up-30485990)**

That's according to Sky Germany's Florian Plettenberg, who claim the Reds 'board and coach coaching staff are extremely satisfied with his performances.'

He tweeted: "Noussair #Mazraoui is internally regarded as one of the strongest signings of recent years at @ManUtd. Both the board and the coaching staff are extremely satisfied with his performances. He is seen as an absolute leader and is expected to continue in this role under Ruben #Amorim in the future. Contract until 2028."

It's very difficult to argue otherwise. The defender has made 19 appearances in all competitions with two assists to his name and is already justifying the transfer fee paid earlier this summer.

> Noussair [#Mazraoui](https://twitter.com/hashtag/Mazraoui?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) is internally regarded as one of the strongest signings of recent years at [@ManUtd](https://twitter.com/ManUtd?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw).  
>   
> Both the board and the coaching staff are extremely satisfied with his performances. He is seen as an absolute leader and is expected to continue in this role under Ruben… [pic.twitter.com/sakzYWLwyP](https://t.co/sakzYWLwyP)
> 
> — Florian Plettenberg (@Plettigoal) [November 29, 2024](https://twitter.com/Plettigoal/status/1862607968073916683?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

On the other hand, it's perhaps indicative of United's recent luck in the transfer window that the defender is viewed as one of the best signings in recent seasons, with the Reds struggling in the bottom half of the table.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) will hope Mazraoui's form continues and is able to help United break into the top-half of the table and push on towards the European places.

data: {"title":"Erik ten Hag's Man United signing given green light as true stance emerges","description":"Erik ten Hag was given the green light to sign one of his former players in the summer and the Manchester United board have been impressed","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-man-united-30486981","content":"Erik ten Hag's Man United signing before brutal sacking given green light as true stance emerges - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Erik ten Hag's Man United signing before brutal sacking given green light as true stance emerges
================================================================================================

Erik ten Hag was given the green light to sign one of his former players in the summer and the Manchester United board have been impressed
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-man-united-30486981#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

Matty Hewitt

*   16:30, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Erik ten Hag and Noussair Mazraoui](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article29783812.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2166325398.jpg)

Erik ten Hag signed Noussair Mazraoui in the summer transfer window for Manchester United

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

It's fair to say Erik ten Hag's signings at Manchester United struggled to make a major impact at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford). That was until the arrival of [Noussair Mazraoui](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/noussair-mazraoui-doing-what-manchester-30477349) earlier this summer.

The Moroccan international has been one of the standout performers from a disappointing campaign for the Reds after joining the club from Bayern Munich earlier this summer. The 27-year-old, who worked with [Ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) during their time at Ajax, signed a four-year deal and has been an ever present so far this season.

Signing for a reported initial fee of for an initial fee of £12.8m, that transfer fee now looks like a steal after impressing in his first few months at United. Mazraoui has impressed that much, he's viewed internally as the best signing the club have made in recent years.

**READ MORE: [Sir Jim Ratcliffe and Ineos are betraying Manchester United fans over ticket price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/sir-jim-ratcliffe-ineos-betraying-30480953)**

**READ MORE: [Manchester United predicted line-up vs Everton as new midfield unleashed and Amad recalled](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-predicted-line-up-30485990)**

That's according to Sky Germany's Florian Plettenberg, who claim the Reds 'board and coach coaching staff are extremely satisfied with his performances.'

He tweeted: "Noussair #Mazraoui is internally regarded as one of the strongest signings of recent years at @ManUtd. Both the board and the coaching staff are extremely satisfied with his performances. He is seen as an absolute leader and is expected to continue in this role under Ruben #Amorim in the future. Contract until 2028."

It's very difficult to argue otherwise. The defender has made 19 appearances in all competitions with two assists to his name and is already justifying the transfer fee paid earlier this summer.

> Noussair [#Mazraoui](https://twitter.com/hashtag/Mazraoui?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) is internally regarded as one of the strongest signings of recent years at [@ManUtd](https://twitter.com/ManUtd?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw).  
>   
> Both the board and the coaching staff are extremely satisfied with his performances. He is seen as an absolute leader and is expected to continue in this role under Ruben… [pic.twitter.com/sakzYWLwyP](https://t.co/sakzYWLwyP)
> 
> — Florian Plettenberg (@Plettigoal) [November 29, 2024](https://twitter.com/Plettigoal/status/1862607968073916683?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

On the other hand, it's perhaps indicative of United's recent luck in the transfer window that the defender is viewed as one of the best signings in recent seasons, with the Reds struggling in the bottom half of the table.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) will hope Mazraoui's form continues and is able to help United break into the top-half of the table and push on towards the European places.

Erik ten Hag's Man United signing before brutal sacking given green light as true stance emerges
================================================================================================

Erik ten Hag was given the green light to sign one of his former players in the summer and the Manchester United board have been impressed
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Erik ten Hag signed Noussair Mazraoui in the summer transfer window for Manchester United

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

It's fair to say Erik ten Hag's signings at Manchester United struggled to make a major impact at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford). That was until the arrival of [Noussair Mazraoui](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/noussair-mazraoui-doing-what-manchester-30477349) earlier this summer.

The Moroccan international has been one of the standout performers from a disappointing campaign for the Reds after joining the club from Bayern Munich earlier this summer. The 27-year-old, who worked with [Ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) during their time at Ajax, signed a four-year deal and has been an ever present so far this season.

Signing for a reported initial fee of for an initial fee of £12.8m, that transfer fee now looks like a steal after impressing in his first few months at United. Mazraoui has impressed that much, he's viewed internally as the best signing the club have made in recent years.

**READ MORE: [Sir Jim Ratcliffe and Ineos are betraying Manchester United fans over ticket price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/sir-jim-ratcliffe-ineos-betraying-30480953)**

**READ MORE: [Manchester United predicted line-up vs Everton as new midfield unleashed and Amad recalled](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-predicted-line-up-30485990)**

That's according to Sky Germany's Florian Plettenberg, who claim the Reds 'board and coach coaching staff are extremely satisfied with his performances.'

He tweeted: "Noussair #Mazraoui is internally regarded as one of the strongest signings of recent years at @ManUtd. Both the board and the coaching staff are extremely satisfied with his performances. He is seen as an absolute leader and is expected to continue in this role under Ruben #Amorim in the future. Contract until 2028."

It's very difficult to argue otherwise. The defender has made 19 appearances in all competitions with two assists to his name and is already justifying the transfer fee paid earlier this summer.

On the other hand, it's perhaps indicative of United's recent luck in the transfer window that the defender is viewed as one of the best signings in recent seasons, with the Reds struggling in the bottom half of the table.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) will hope Mazraoui's form continues and is able to help United break into the top-half of the table and push on towards the European places.

Ruben Amorim discovers new Man United 'undroppable' in thumping Everton win
===========================================================================

Manchester United have thumped Everton 4-0 with Bruno Fernandes and Amad Diallo starring in the Premier League win at Old Trafford on Sunday
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Share

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

Thomas FairCommunity Editor

*   16:22, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim during his side's game against Everton](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30492324.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ruben-Amorim.jpg)

Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim watched his side cruise to victory against Everton (Image: Robbie Jay Barratt - AMA/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ruben Amorim has claimed his first Premier League victory in a new era for [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), with his team brushing aside Everton with a 4-0 win - and Manchester Evening News readers in [our comments section](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/sport-opinion/hes-undroppable-manchester-united-win-30492106#comments-wrapper) are full of praise for one man in particular.

It was Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee's turns to step up and prove a point to their new manager, both providing two goals in both halves. Everton had no response, and it was former transfer target Jarrad Branthwaite who ended up gifting some of those goals to United.

Amad Diallo took full advantage of his chance to impress too, matching Bruno Fernandes' contribution of two assists. It was an ideal way for Amorim to end his first home game in charge of United, and there are visible signs that his coaching is starting to bear fruit.

The result lifts Manchester United into 9th place in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league), and returns the team to having a positive goal difference in the competition.

Fans have only got kind words for one man on the pitch today. Reader Jnkem says: "Amad is very dangerous! Ten Hag did him wrong by favoring Antony!" Evillah agrees: "Amad you beauty!"

Commenter Noronny writes: "Amad is undroppable. Man of the match. He's got skill, energy, he's unselfish. Mazraoui is undroppable as well. Every other position is up for grabs."

Red Devil says: "Amorim has got them at it with good substitutions, nobody is safe, he's testing them out. Amad looking to be a really good prospect if he keeps grounded! Excellent young player, keep it up."

1968red reckons we're getting a glimpse of what United should've been this season: "Zirkzee with goals, Amad with 2 assists, and Rashford 2 goals. Where have this Zirkzee and this Rashford been hiding all this time?!

"We're winning again. Makes you wonder where we'd be if we had Amorim from the start, and Ratcliffe hadn't dithered about by giving Ten Hag more time. Amad is flourishing now when Ten Hag hardly gave him a look in over Antony. Even Zirkzee and Rashford have made positive steps today."

Glazerclowns writes: "This is promising. Zirkzee has his goals which will hopefully kickstart his career."

Garyfoxtrot has one complaint: "I know it was Everton, but some good intent on display, and good to be in positive GD. Hate the back and forth passing sideways at the back, we been done in by better teams for that. Job done Utd." Denislawking agrees: "I hate the walking pace from the back and the constant sideways passing. Modern game I guess."

Dravic says: "Well Amorin did say he wanted to get our strikers scoring, job done so far!"

**Have your say! Who is making themselves key to Amorim's Manchester United so far? Has anyone impressed that you didn't expect? [Comment below, and join in on the conversation](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/sport-opinion/hes-undroppable-manchester-united-win-30492106#comments-wrapper).**

Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim watched his side cruise to victory against Everton (Image: Robbie Jay Barratt - AMA/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Ruben Amorim has claimed his first Premier League victory in a new era for [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), with his team brushing aside Everton with a 4-0 win - and Manchester Evening News readers in [our comments section](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/sport-opinion/hes-undroppable-manchester-united-win-30492106#comments-wrapper) are full of praise for one man in particular.

It was Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee's turns to step up and prove a point to their new manager, both providing two goals in both halves. Everton had no response, and it was former transfer target Jarrad Branthwaite who ended up gifting some of those goals to United.

Amad Diallo took full advantage of his chance to impress too, matching Bruno Fernandes' contribution of two assists. It was an ideal way for Amorim to end his first home game in charge of United, and there are visible signs that his coaching is starting to bear fruit.

The result lifts Manchester United into 9th place in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league), and returns the team to having a positive goal difference in the competition.

Fans have only got kind words for one man on the pitch today. Reader Jnkem says: "Amad is very dangerous! Ten Hag did him wrong by favoring Antony!" Evillah agrees: "Amad you beauty!"

Commenter Noronny writes: "Amad is undroppable. Man of the match. He's got skill, energy, he's unselfish. Mazraoui is undroppable as well. Every other position is up for grabs."

Red Devil says: "Amorim has got them at it with good substitutions, nobody is safe, he's testing them out. Amad looking to be a really good prospect if he keeps grounded! Excellent young player, keep it up."

1968red reckons we're getting a glimpse of what United should've been this season: "Zirkzee with goals, Amad with 2 assists, and Rashford 2 goals. Where have this Zirkzee and this Rashford been hiding all this time?!

"We're winning again. Makes you wonder where we'd be if we had Amorim from the start, and Ratcliffe hadn't dithered about by giving Ten Hag more time. Amad is flourishing now when Ten Hag hardly gave him a look in over Antony. Even Zirkzee and Rashford have made positive steps today."

Glazerclowns writes: "This is promising. Zirkzee has his goals which will hopefully kickstart his career."

Garyfoxtrot has one complaint: "I know it was Everton, but some good intent on display, and good to be in positive GD. Hate the back and forth passing sideways at the back, we been done in by better teams for that. Job done Utd." Denislawking agrees: "I hate the walking pace from the back and the constant sideways passing. Modern game I guess."

Dravic says: "Well Amorin did say he wanted to get our strikers scoring, job done so far!"

**Have your say! Who is making themselves key to Amorim's Manchester United so far? Has anyone impressed that you didn't expect? [Comment below, and join in on the conversation](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/sport-opinion/hes-undroppable-manchester-united-win-30492106#comments-wrapper).**

data: {"title":"Ruben Amorim discovers new Man United 'undroppable' in thumping Everton win","description":"Manchester United have thumped Everton 4-0 with Bruno Fernandes and Amad Diallo starring in the Premier League win at Old Trafford on Sunday","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-discovers-new-man-30492106","content":"Ruben Amorim discovers new Man United 'undroppable' in thumping Everton win - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Ruben Amorim discovers new Man United 'undroppable' in thumping Everton win
===========================================================================

Manchester United have thumped Everton 4-0 with Bruno Fernandes and Amad Diallo starring in the Premier League win at Old Trafford on Sunday
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-discovers-new-man-30492106#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

Thomas FairCommunity Editor

*   16:22, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim during his side's game against Everton](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30492324.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ruben-Amorim.jpg)

Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim watched his side cruise to victory against Everton (Image: Robbie Jay Barratt - AMA/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ruben Amorim has claimed his first Premier League victory in a new era for [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), with his team brushing aside Everton with a 4-0 win - and Manchester Evening News readers in [our comments section](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/sport-opinion/hes-undroppable-manchester-united-win-30492106#comments-wrapper) are full of praise for one man in particular.

It was Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee's turns to step up and prove a point to their new manager, both providing two goals in both halves. Everton had no response, and it was former transfer target Jarrad Branthwaite who ended up gifting some of those goals to United.

Amad Diallo took full advantage of his chance to impress too, matching Bruno Fernandes' contribution of two assists. It was an ideal way for Amorim to end his first home game in charge of United, and there are visible signs that his coaching is starting to bear fruit.

The result lifts Manchester United into 9th place in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league), and returns the team to having a positive goal difference in the competition.

Fans have only got kind words for one man on the pitch today. Reader Jnkem says: "Amad is very dangerous! Ten Hag did him wrong by favoring Antony!" Evillah agrees: "Amad you beauty!"

Commenter Noronny writes: "Amad is undroppable. Man of the match. He's got skill, energy, he's unselfish. Mazraoui is undroppable as well. Every other position is up for grabs."

Red Devil says: "Amorim has got them at it with good substitutions, nobody is safe, he's testing them out. Amad looking to be a really good prospect if he keeps grounded! Excellent young player, keep it up."

1968red reckons we're getting a glimpse of what United should've been this season: "Zirkzee with goals, Amad with 2 assists, and Rashford 2 goals. Where have this Zirkzee and this Rashford been hiding all this time?!

"We're winning again. Makes you wonder where we'd be if we had Amorim from the start, and Ratcliffe hadn't dithered about by giving Ten Hag more time. Amad is flourishing now when Ten Hag hardly gave him a look in over Antony. Even Zirkzee and Rashford have made positive steps today."

Glazerclowns writes: "This is promising. Zirkzee has his goals which will hopefully kickstart his career."

Garyfoxtrot has one complaint: "I know it was Everton, but some good intent on display, and good to be in positive GD. Hate the back and forth passing sideways at the back, we been done in by better teams for that. Job done Utd." Denislawking agrees: "I hate the walking pace from the back and the constant sideways passing. Modern game I guess."

Dravic says: "Well Amorin did say he wanted to get our strikers scoring, job done so far!"

**Have your say! Who is making themselves key to Amorim's Manchester United so far? Has anyone impressed that you didn't expect? [Comment below, and join in on the conversation](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/sport-opinion/hes-undroppable-manchester-united-win-30492106#comments-wrapper).**

data: {"title":"Ruben Amorim discovers new Man United 'undroppable' in thumping Everton win","description":"Manchester United have thumped Everton 4-0 with Bruno Fernandes and Amad Diallo starring in the Premier League win at Old Trafford on Sunday","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-discovers-new-man-30492106","content":"Ruben Amorim discovers new Man United 'undroppable' in thumping Everton win - Manchester Evening News

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Ruben Amorim discovers new Man United 'undroppable' in thumping Everton win
===========================================================================

Manchester United have thumped Everton 4-0 with Bruno Fernandes and Amad Diallo starring in the Premier League win at Old Trafford on Sunday
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-discovers-new-man-30492106#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

Thomas FairCommunity Editor

*   16:22, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim during his side's game against Everton](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30492324.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ruben-Amorim.jpg)

Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim watched his side cruise to victory against Everton (Image: Robbie Jay Barratt - AMA/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ruben Amorim has claimed his first Premier League victory in a new era for [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc), with his team brushing aside Everton with a 4-0 win - and Manchester Evening News readers in [our comments section](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/sport-opinion/hes-undroppable-manchester-united-win-30492106#comments-wrapper) are full of praise for one man in particular.

It was Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee's turns to step up and prove a point to their new manager, both providing two goals in both halves. Everton had no response, and it was former transfer target Jarrad Branthwaite who ended up gifting some of those goals to United.

Amad Diallo took full advantage of his chance to impress too, matching Bruno Fernandes' contribution of two assists. It was an ideal way for Amorim to end his first home game in charge of United, and there are visible signs that his coaching is starting to bear fruit.

The result lifts Manchester United into 9th place in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league), and returns the team to having a positive goal difference in the competition.

Fans have only got kind words for one man on the pitch today. Reader Jnkem says: "Amad is very dangerous! Ten Hag did him wrong by favoring Antony!" Evillah agrees: "Amad you beauty!"

Commenter Noronny writes: "Amad is undroppable. Man of the match. He's got skill, energy, he's unselfish. Mazraoui is undroppable as well. Every other position is up for grabs."

Red Devil says: "Amorim has got them at it with good substitutions, nobody is safe, he's testing them out. Amad looking to be a really good prospect if he keeps grounded! Excellent young player, keep it up."

1968red reckons we're getting a glimpse of what United should've been this season: "Zirkzee with goals, Amad with 2 assists, and Rashford 2 goals. Where have this Zirkzee and this Rashford been hiding all this time?!

"We're winning again. Makes you wonder where we'd be if we had Amorim from the start, and Ratcliffe hadn't dithered about by giving Ten Hag more time. Amad is flourishing now when Ten Hag hardly gave him a look in over Antony. Even Zirkzee and Rashford have made positive steps today."

Glazerclowns writes: "This is promising. Zirkzee has his goals which will hopefully kickstart his career."

Garyfoxtrot has one complaint: "I know it was Everton, but some good intent on display, and good to be in positive GD. Hate the back and forth passing sideways at the back, we been done in by better teams for that. Job done Utd." Denislawking agrees: "I hate the walking pace from the back and the constant sideways passing. Modern game I guess."

Dravic says: "Well Amorin did say he wanted to get our strikers scoring, job done so far!"

**Have your say! Who is making themselves key to Amorim's Manchester United so far? Has anyone impressed that you didn't expect? [Comment below, and join in on the conversation](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/sport-opinion/hes-undroppable-manchester-united-win-30492106#comments-wrapper).**

'Impossible' - Ruben Amorim explains shock Manchester United team selection vs Everton
======================================================================================

Man United head coach Ruben Amorim has made six changes to his starting line-up for the Premier League clash with Everton.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim has made more changes](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30491002.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_IMG_6655.jpg)

Ruben Amorim has made more changes (Image: MUTV.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ruben Amorim has said it is "impossible" to play the same team with games coming thick and fast for [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc).

The [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) boss has made six changes to his starting line-up for the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) clash with Everton, handing recalls to Diogo Dalot, Kobbie Mainoo, Joshua Zirkzee, Marcus Rashford, Casemiro and Amad.

Amorim has made no secret of the need to rotate his team to combat United's busy fixture schedule. Today's clash with Everton marks the first of nine games the Reds must navigate in the month of December.

**READ MORE: [United vs Everton LIVE](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-vs-everton-live-30489781)**

**READ MORE:** **[Manuel Ugarte is doing what Dan Ashworth said he would do at United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manuel-ugarte-doing-what-dan-30487343)**

Amorim, speaking to MUTV, said: "It is impossible to cope with all the games with the same team. We have to be ready, we are changing the way we are playing and everybody has to play and has to train.

"It is impossible in three days to recover all of the players. We played a different game against Bodo/Glimt, we pressed a lot, some players were tired, so I clearly prefer to have fresh legs.

"I also want us to have different characteristics to be harder for the opponent to understand how we are going to play. We have returns like Kobbie Mainoo, one of the best youngsters in this league.

"We have international players, just like I say all the time, and they are ready to win the game."

'Impossible' - Ruben Amorim explains shock Manchester United team selection vs Everton
======================================================================================

Man United head coach Ruben Amorim has made six changes to his starting line-up for the Premier League clash with Everton.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/impossible-ruben-amorim-explains-shock-30491001#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   13:03, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim has made more changes](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30491002.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_IMG_6655.jpg)

Ruben Amorim has made more changes (Image: MUTV.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ruben Amorim has said it is "impossible" to play the same team with games coming thick and fast for [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc).

The [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) boss has made six changes to his starting line-up for the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) clash with Everton, handing recalls to Diogo Dalot, Kobbie Mainoo, Joshua Zirkzee, Marcus Rashford, Casemiro and Amad.

Amorim has made no secret of the need to rotate his team to combat United's busy fixture schedule. Today's clash with Everton marks the first of nine games the Reds must navigate in the month of December.

**READ MORE: [United vs Everton LIVE](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-vs-everton-live-30489781)**

**READ MORE:** **[Manuel Ugarte is doing what Dan Ashworth said he would do at United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manuel-ugarte-doing-what-dan-30487343)**

Amorim, speaking to MUTV, said: "It is impossible to cope with all the games with the same team. We have to be ready, we are changing the way we are playing and everybody has to play and has to train.

"It is impossible in three days to recover all of the players. We played a different game against Bodo/Glimt, we pressed a lot, some players were tired, so I clearly prefer to have fresh legs.

"I also want us to have different characteristics to be harder for the opponent to understand how we are going to play. We have returns like Kobbie Mainoo, one of the best youngsters in this league.

"We have international players, just like I say all the time, and they are ready to win the game."

'Impossible' - Ruben Amorim explains shock Manchester United team selection vs Everton
======================================================================================

Man United head coach Ruben Amorim has made six changes to his starting line-up for the Premier League clash with Everton.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments1](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/impossible-ruben-amorim-explains-shock-30491001#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   13:03, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim has made more changes](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30491002.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_IMG_6655.jpg)

Ruben Amorim has made more changes (Image: MUTV.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ruben Amorim has said it is "impossible" to play the same team with games coming thick and fast for [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc).

The [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) boss has made six changes to his starting line-up for the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) clash with Everton, handing recalls to Diogo Dalot, Kobbie Mainoo, Joshua Zirkzee, Marcus Rashford, Casemiro and Amad.

Amorim has made no secret of the need to rotate his team to combat United's busy fixture schedule. Today's clash with Everton marks the first of nine games the Reds must navigate in the month of December.

**READ MORE: [United vs Everton LIVE](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-vs-everton-live-30489781)**

**READ MORE:** **[Manuel Ugarte is doing what Dan Ashworth said he would do at United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manuel-ugarte-doing-what-dan-30487343)**

Amorim, speaking to MUTV, said: "It is impossible to cope with all the games with the same team. We have to be ready, we are changing the way we are playing and everybody has to play and has to train.

"It is impossible in three days to recover all of the players. We played a different game against Bodo/Glimt, we pressed a lot, some players were tired, so I clearly prefer to have fresh legs.

"I also want us to have different characteristics to be harder for the opponent to understand how we are going to play. We have returns like Kobbie Mainoo, one of the best youngsters in this league.

"We have international players, just like I say all the time, and they are ready to win the game."

data: {"title":"'Impossible' - Ruben Amorim explains shock Man United team selection vs Everton","description":"Man United head coach Ruben Amorim has made six changes to his starting line-up for the Premier League clash with Everton.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/impossible-ruben-amorim-explains-shock-30491001","content":"'Impossible' - Ruben Amorim explains shock Manchester United team selection vs Everton - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

'Impossible' - Ruben Amorim explains shock Manchester United team selection vs Everton
======================================================================================

Man United head coach Ruben Amorim has made six changes to his starting line-up for the Premier League clash with Everton.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments1](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/impossible-ruben-amorim-explains-shock-30491001#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   13:03, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim has made more changes](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30491002.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_IMG_6655.jpg)

Ruben Amorim has made more changes (Image: MUTV.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ruben Amorim has said it is "impossible" to play the same team with games coming thick and fast for [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc).

The [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) boss has made six changes to his starting line-up for the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) clash with Everton, handing recalls to Diogo Dalot, Kobbie Mainoo, Joshua Zirkzee, Marcus Rashford, Casemiro and Amad.

Amorim has made no secret of the need to rotate his team to combat United's busy fixture schedule. Today's clash with Everton marks the first of nine games the Reds must navigate in the month of December.

**READ MORE: [United vs Everton LIVE](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-vs-everton-live-30489781)**

**READ MORE:** **[Manuel Ugarte is doing what Dan Ashworth said he would do at United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manuel-ugarte-doing-what-dan-30487343)**

Amorim, speaking to MUTV, said: "It is impossible to cope with all the games with the same team. We have to be ready, we are changing the way we are playing and everybody has to play and has to train.

"It is impossible in three days to recover all of the players. We played a different game against Bodo/Glimt, we pressed a lot, some players were tired, so I clearly prefer to have fresh legs.

"I also want us to have different characteristics to be harder for the opponent to understand how we are going to play. We have returns like Kobbie Mainoo, one of the best youngsters in this league.

"We have international players, just like I say all the time, and they are ready to win the game."

'Impossible' - Ruben Amorim explains shock Manchester United team selection vs Everton
======================================================================================

Man United head coach Ruben Amorim has made six changes to his starting line-up for the Premier League clash with Everton.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments1](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/impossible-ruben-amorim-explains-shock-30491001#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   13:03, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim has made more changes](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30491002.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_IMG_6655.jpg)

Ruben Amorim has made more changes (Image: MUTV.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ruben Amorim has said it is "impossible" to play the same team with games coming thick and fast for [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc).

The [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) boss has made six changes to his starting line-up for the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) clash with Everton, handing recalls to Diogo Dalot, Kobbie Mainoo, Joshua Zirkzee, Marcus Rashford, Casemiro and Amad.

Amorim has made no secret of the need to rotate his team to combat United's busy fixture schedule. Today's clash with Everton marks the first of nine games the Reds must navigate in the month of December.

**READ MORE: [United vs Everton LIVE](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-vs-everton-live-30489781)**

**READ MORE:** **[Manuel Ugarte is doing what Dan Ashworth said he would do at United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manuel-ugarte-doing-what-dan-30487343)**

Amorim, speaking to MUTV, said: "It is impossible to cope with all the games with the same team. We have to be ready, we are changing the way we are playing and everybody has to play and has to train.

"It is impossible in three days to recover all of the players. We played a different game against Bodo/Glimt, we pressed a lot, some players were tired, so I clearly prefer to have fresh legs.

"I also want us to have different characteristics to be harder for the opponent to understand how we are going to play. We have returns like Kobbie Mainoo, one of the best youngsters in this league.

"We have international players, just like I say all the time, and they are ready to win the game."

Manchester United's new head coach Ruben Amorim enjoyed the perfect afternoon on his [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) home debut as Everton were put to the sword at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

Shortly after the half-hour mark, [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) opened the scoring with a deflected effort before [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) scored to double the advantage at the break. Immediately after the restart, Rashford had his second of the game as he latched on to an Amad pass to make it 3-0.

Zirkzee would grab a brace of his own less than 20 minutes later as the game was put out of the reach of Sean Dyche's men. With another victory in the bag, _MEN Sport_ has taken a closer look at what is to come for [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) in the next five fixtures.

### United's next fixtures

December 4 vs Arsenal (A) at 8.15pm - [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league)

December 7 vs Nott’m Forest (H) at 5.30pm - Premier League

December 12 vs Viktoria Plzen (A) at 5.45pm - [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league)

December 15 vs [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) (A) at 4.30pm - Premier League

December 19 vs Tottenham (A) at 8pm - Carabao Cup

_Our verdict: It has been a good start to life in England for Amorim but these next five fixtures will be the real test of his managerial abilities. The immediate threat is Arsenal who have been in sparkling form since the international break ended. The so-called easier fixtures against Forest and Viktoria Plzen will be dangerous for the Reds before the big one against City in the middle of the month. Tottenham provides a difficult obstacle too, but due to it being the League Cup, that could be an opportunity for further rotation for United. Either way, we will have a better grasp of Amorim's start in Manchester after these fixtures._

Man United next five fixtures compared to Arsenal, Chelsea and other Premier League rivals
==========================================================================================

Manchester United have returned to winning ways in the Premier League with a thumping victory over Everton at Old Trafford
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![Image 1: Manchester United players celebrate during the victory over Everton](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491872.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187703760.jpg)

Manchester United players celebrate during the victory over Everton (Image: James Gill - Danehouse/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United's new head coach Ruben Amorim enjoyed the perfect afternoon on his [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) home debut as Everton were put to the sword at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

Shortly after the half-hour mark, [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) opened the scoring with a deflected effort before [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) scored to double the advantage at the break. Immediately after the restart, Rashford had his second of the game as he latched on to an Amad pass to make it 3-0.

Zirkzee would grab a brace of his own less than 20 minutes later as the game was put out of the reach of Sean Dyche's men. With another victory in the bag, _MEN Sport_ has taken a closer look at what is to come for [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) in the next five fixtures.

**READ MORE: [Amorim handed huge double blow for Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-handed-huge-double-30491567)**

**READ MORE: [I have become a fan favourite but I didn't know they loved me that much](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/become-fans-favourite-manchester-united-30482227)**

### United's next fixtures

December 4 vs Arsenal (A) at 8.15pm - [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league)

December 7 vs Nott’m Forest (H) at 5.30pm - Premier League

December 12 vs Viktoria Plzen (A) at 5.45pm - [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league)

December 15 vs [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) (A) at 4.30pm - Premier League

December 19 vs Tottenham (A) at 8pm - Carabao Cup

_Our verdict: It has been a good start to life in England for Amorim but these next five fixtures will be the real test of his managerial abilities. The immediate threat is Arsenal who have been in sparkling form since the international break ended. The so-called easier fixtures against Forest and Viktoria Plzen will be dangerous for the Reds before the big one against City in the middle of the month. Tottenham provides a difficult obstacle too, but due to it being the League Cup, that could be an opportunity for further rotation for United. Either way, we will have a better grasp of Amorim's start in Manchester after these fixtures._

### Arsenal's next fixtures

December 4 vs [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) (H) at 8.15pm - Premier League

December 8 vs Fulham (A) at 2pm - Premier League

December 11 vs AS Monaco (H) at 8pm - [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league)

December 14 vs Everton (H) at 3pm - Premier League

December 18 vs Crystal Palace (H) at 7.30pm - Carabao Cup

### Chelsea's next fixtures

December 4 vs Southampton (A) at 7.30pm - Premier League

December 8 vs Tottenham (A) at 4.30pm - Premier League

December 12 vs Astana (A) at 3.30pm - Conference League

December 15 vs Brentford (H) at 7pm - Premier League

December 19 vs Shamrock Rovers (H) at 8pm - Conference League

### Manchester City's next fixtures

December 1 vs [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) (A) at 4pm - Premier League

December 4 vs Nott’m Forest (H) at 7.30pm - Premier League

December 7 vs Crystal Palace (A) at 3pm - Premier League

December 11 vs Juventus (A) at 8pm - Champions League

December 15 vs Manchester United (H) at 4.30pm - Premier League

### Tottenham's next fixtures

December 5 vs AFC Bournemouth (A) at 8.15pm - Premier League

December 8 vs [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) (H) at 4.30pm - Premier League

December 12 vs Rangers (A) at 8pm - Europa League

December 15 vs Southampton (A) at 7pm - Premier League

December 19 vs Manchester United (H) at 8pm - Carabao Cup

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Man United next five fixtures compared to Arsenal, Chelsea and other Premier League rivals
==========================================================================================

Manchester United have returned to winning ways in the Premier League with a thumping victory over Everton at Old Trafford
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   15:26, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United players celebrate during the victory over Everton](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491872.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187703760.jpg)

Manchester United players celebrate during the victory over Everton (Image: James Gill - Danehouse/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United's new head coach Ruben Amorim enjoyed the perfect afternoon on his [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) home debut as Everton were put to the sword at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

Shortly after the half-hour mark, [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) opened the scoring with a deflected effort before [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) scored to double the advantage at the break. Immediately after the restart, Rashford had his second of the game as he latched on to an Amad pass to make it 3-0.

Zirkzee would grab a brace of his own less than 20 minutes later as the game was put out of the reach of Sean Dyche's men. With another victory in the bag, _MEN Sport_ has taken a closer look at what is to come for [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) in the next five fixtures.

**READ MORE: [Amorim handed huge double blow for Arsenal](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-handed-huge-double-30491567)**

**READ MORE: [I have become a fan favourite but I didn't know they loved me that much](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/become-fans-favourite-manchester-united-30482227)**

### United's next fixtures

December 4 vs Arsenal (A) at 8.15pm - [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league)

December 7 vs Nott’m Forest (H) at 5.30pm - Premier League

December 12 vs Viktoria Plzen (A) at 5.45pm - [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league)

December 15 vs [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) (A) at 4.30pm - Premier League

December 19 vs Tottenham (A) at 8pm - Carabao Cup

_Our verdict: It has been a good start to life in England for Amorim but these next five fixtures will be the real test of his managerial abilities. The immediate threat is Arsenal who have been in sparkling form since the international break ended. The so-called easier fixtures against Forest and Viktoria Plzen will be dangerous for the Reds before the big one against City in the middle of the month. Tottenham provides a difficult obstacle too, but due to it being the League Cup, that could be an opportunity for further rotation for United. Either way, we will have a better grasp of Amorim's start in Manchester after these fixtures._

===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Man United next five fixtures compared to Arsenal, Chelsea and other Premier League rivals
==========================================================================================

Manchester United have returned to winning ways in the Premier League with a thumping victory over Everton at Old Trafford
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-next-five-fixtures-30491676#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   15:26, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United players celebrate during the victory over Everton](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491872.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187703760.jpg)

Manchester United players celebrate during the victory over Everton (Image: James Gill - Danehouse/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United's new head coach Ruben Amorim enjoyed the perfect afternoon on his [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) home debut as Everton were put to the sword at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

Shortly after the half-hour mark, [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) opened the scoring with a deflected effort before [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) scored to double the advantage at the break. Immediately after the restart, Rashford had his second of the game as he latched on to an Amad pass to make it 3-0.

Zirkzee would grab a brace of his own less than 20 minutes later as the game was put out of the reach of Sean Dyche's men. With another victory in the bag, _MEN Sport_ has taken a closer look at what is to come for [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) in the next five fixtures.

### United's next fixtures

December 4 vs Arsenal (A) at 8.15pm - [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league)

December 7 vs Nott’m Forest (H) at 5.30pm - Premier League

December 12 vs Viktoria Plzen (A) at 5.45pm - [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league)

December 15 vs [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) (A) at 4.30pm - Premier League

December 19 vs Tottenham (A) at 8pm - Carabao Cup

_Our verdict: It has been a good start to life in England for Amorim but these next five fixtures will be the real test of his managerial abilities. The immediate threat is Arsenal who have been in sparkling form since the international break ended. The so-called easier fixtures against Forest and Viktoria Plzen will be dangerous for the Reds before the big one against City in the middle of the month. Tottenham provides a difficult obstacle too, but due to it being the League Cup, that could be an opportunity for further rotation for United. Either way, we will have a better grasp of Amorim's start in Manchester after these fixtures._

### Arsenal's next fixtures

December 4 vs [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) (H) at 8.15pm - Premier League

December 11 vs AS Monaco (H) at 8pm - [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league)

December 14 vs Everton (H) at 3pm - Premier League

December 18 vs Crystal Palace (H) at 7.30pm - Carabao Cup

### Chelsea's next fixtures

December 8 vs Tottenham (A) at 4.30pm - Premier League

Man United handed fresh Liam Delap transfer headache as Man City buyback clause explained
=========================================================================================

Latest Manchester United transfer news and gossip includes an update on Liam Delap

[Liam Delap](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liam-delap) continues to catch the attention since leaving [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) in the summer.

So much so that he has been linked with a return to the [Etihad Stadium](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/etihad-stadium), though [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are also on his trail. However, a new report by [the Mirror](https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/chelsea-transfer-news-delap-juventus-34218796) suggests Juventus are eyeing the forward as a replacement for Dusan Vlahovic.

The Italian giants are said to be keen to tie Vlahovic to a new deal but talks over an extension have failed to bear fruit. As a result, that has forced them to look at potential alternatives and Delap is said to fit the profile the club are looking for.

**READ MORE: [How Manchester United should line up vs Everton in Premier League fixture](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/how-manchester-united-should-line-30477877)**

**READ MORE: [Pep Guardiola 'special advisor' can be critical to Man City recovery](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/pep-guardiola-special-advisor-can-30484258)**

The report claims Juve are drawing up contingency plans in case an agreement cannot be reached. So much so that they have already watched Delap in action for Ipswich at Portman Road this campaign.

Meanwhile, United and [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc) are also monitoring his progress. But it's City who have an advantage over other clubs after negotiating a 20 per cent sell-on clause with Ipswich.

Ipswich boss [Kieran McKenna](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kieran-mckenna) has refused to speak over Delap's future. He said: "It's not anything I'm aware of or interested in to be honest. I think that's a question for other people and for \[chairman\] Mark Ashton.

"My full focus is on this season and, with regards to Liam, trying to help him to continue to improve. I know Liam's full focus is here and trying to help the team. He's had a good start to the season, but we have to remember that's it's very early stages for him.

"This is really his first season starting regularly as a number nine. He played off the side a lot of times last year at Hull, played as a wide striker in some earlier Championship loan moves. So this is his first season doing it week-in, week-out, maybe doing it two times a week, and he's doing it at [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) level. It's positive that he's doing well, but it's really early days. His focus, my focus, our focus is to keep trying to improve."

[Delap](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liam-delap) scored a goal and provided an assist as Ipswich recorded a 2-1 win away at Tottenham Hotspur. The win in North London was Ipswich's first victory in the top flight this season since their promotion from the Championship. He also put in a fine performance in the 1-1 draw with United at Portman Road last month.
